item.title: Year in Review
item.description: When I say I had an exhausting year, I’m not lying. I quit my job and started a new one - TWICE I went through a bit of a crisis earlier in the year. The thought of giving up my career gave me so much anxiety so I frantically searched for jobs that would allow me to work from another country. A recruiter contacted me and I was offered a Data Scientist position with a 25% salary increase, but I didn’t want to take it because I knew I was leaving at some point.

item.title: I can't believe I listened to Momoland that much
item.description: At some point during quarantine last year, I found out that you could download a years worth of your Spotify data. Back then I only had 8 months worth of data for 2020, so again, I waited until 2021 to download the rest of it. And since 2021 began, I haven’t found time to do this, until now. Last year, for my Spotify Wrapped, I found out that my top songs of 2020 had not one, but 2 (!

item.title: A Year of Pandemic Activity
item.description: I’ve had an Apple Watch for a while now and I bought it largely because I wanted to start tracking my activity – and to, eventually, analyze this data. In order to do the latter, though, I needed to have owned, worn, and religiously tracked activities using my watch for at least 1 whole calendar year. Now in the summer of 2020, I had some down time and so I downloaded my watch data and started messing around with it.

item.title: Reflections on CS 250
item.description: Over the summer, the members of my lab had the opportunity to audit UW-Milwaukee’s Introduction to Programming class. It was 8 weeks long and entirely online. This was my first time ever taking a class online that wasn’t one those free online short courses from Coursera or FutureLearn. In the weeks prior, I was witness to my sister’s abrupt transition to online classes due to Covid-19 so I expected my course follow a similar format as hers - set lecture times where you watch a video or slideshow with a professor’s voiceover, small group discussion sections, and online homework questionnaires/assignments.

item.title: Japan
item.description: Shibuya Center-Gai, November 2018 Kinkaku-ji, November 2018 To add a bit of color to my blog in the meantime, I’m sharing a couple photos from one of my favorite trips abroad.

item.title: Finally! How I got my blog to work...
item.description: Finally! This blog was over a year in the making, but I finally managed to get it to work. It took me a REALLY long time to realize that my dissatisfaction with my GitHub username was causing all the blog deployment hiccups. I’ve been intending to start a blog as a showcase or dumping site of sorts. It might be a slow start because I’m learning the intricacies of blogdown and GitHub, as well as deciding on how to appropriately structure my content without becoming a huge mess.
